faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: Course about the fundamentals of neurochemistry. Detailed study of chemical transmission, including metabolism, neuroanatomical distribution, pharmacology, and functions of neurotransmitters. There is also overview about neurochemical methods available at the chair of bioorganic chemistry of UT.  All attendees have to present report about connections between his/her studies and neurochemistry.
description.et: Kursus närvirakkude keemilise ehituse ja nendega seotud keemiliste ning biofüüsikaliste protsesside alustest, käsitledes eelkõige retseptorvalkude struktuuri ning nendega seotud protsesse. Lisaks üldloengutele, antakse ülevaade ka TÜ bioorgaanilise keemia õppetoolis kasutatavatest meetoditest ning viiakse läbi seminarid, kus kursusest osavõtjad toovad esile oma uurimistöö ja neurokeemia vahelised seosed.

objectives.en: To give overview about chemical processes in nervous system. Special attention will be paid on the mechanisms of functioning of different receptors and their effector systems, but also  on methods used in these studies.
objectives.et: Anda ülevaade närvisüsteemis toimuvate protsesside keemilisest olemusest. Põhitähelepanu pööratakse retseptorite ja nende efektorsüsteemide funktsioonidele ning nende määramise meetoditest.

learning_outcomes.en: The student who passed the course successfully:
- knows general structure of receptor systems and is able to find more specific information about these systems.
learning_outcomes.et: oTeab üldist retseptorsüsteemide ehitust ja toimemehhanisme ning oskab leida selle kohta vajalikku informatsiooni.

learning_outcomes.en: - knows general methods of neurochemistry and their possibilities;
learning_outcomes.et: oTunneb üldisi neurokeemias kasutatavaid uurimismeetodeid ja nende võimalusi.

learning_outcomes.en: - Is able to find connections between his/her studies and neurochemistry;
learning_outcomes.et: oOskab positsioneerida oma uurimisteemat neurokeemia suhtes ning leida nendevahelisi seoseid.

independent_work.et:
Presentations "Neurochemistry in my project." in seminar 12 min (±3 min)
2 test questions (with 5 answers - 1 correct) about your own presentation
Presentation and questions has to be sent to ago.rinken@ut.ee, latest Oct. 28 at 15.00
Opinion about the presentations of other students.

grade_preconditions.et: Presentations "Neurochemistry in my project." is discussed in seminar and materials and opinion sent to teacher

grade_evaluation.et:
50% presentation (35% from supervisors + 10 % from students+ 5% opinion)
50% test

debt_elimination.et: New test in agreement with supervisor

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.recommended_materials:
Siegel GJ et. al. Basic Neurochemistry (7.ed) Lippincott Williams @ Wilkins 2006. (8.ed) Academic Press, Elsevier
Krauss G. Biochemistry of Signal Transduction and Regulation (5. ed) Wiley-VCH 2014

description.et:
Introduction. Prof. Ago Rinken
*	General questions - What is LOKT.10.007 Basic Neurochemistry. What is neurochemistry and its position in science?
*	Signal transduction, general overview.
*	Membranes, receptors, transporters, terms and classification

Dr. Anton Terasmaa
*	Membrane potential, electric signal transmission
*	Ion channels and ion channel receptors

Prof. Johannes Hirrlinger (Leipzig University/Max Planck Institute)
*	Brain metabolism: views and news
  
*	Mouse genetics to study brain function

Public lecture seminar by Prof. Johannes Hirrlinger (Leipzig University/Max Planck Institute) in Ch 1021
Brain energy metabolism assessed by genetically encoded sensors for metabolites

Prof. Ago Rinken
GPCR, and their ligands (synthesis, uptake, transport etc). (in aud. 3070)

Dr. Darja Lavõgina
*	Secondary messenger systems (different G proteins, secondary messengers, signal transduction pathways, termination of signal transduction)
NB! Please make sure that you take your laptop with installed VPN ( https://wiki.ut.ee/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=17105590 ) with you - there will be a teamwork where literature search is required.

Reet Link
*	Hormones
*	Peptides and proteins as hormones
*	Steroid hormones

Dr. Erki Enkvist / Dr. Kaido Viht
*	Phosphorylation as an important regulation mechanism in the organism. Its role in signal transduction. Protein kinases as drug targets.
 ,

Dr. Sergei Kopantšuk
*	How to study receptors - methods and equipment

*	Seminar. Presentation from all participating students "My research and its connections with neurochemistry" (12 ± 3 min + 5 ± 2 min for discussion)
